creator: zin@jaist.ac.jp
text:
Created attachment 23659
Patch for modules/ftp/ftp_commands.c

FTP RETR return '550 No such file or directory' after starting file transfer if client request file with relative path name.

Followings are example of this failure. The first request success with fully-qualified path name, and the second one fail with relative path name.

> ftp> get /pub/NetBSD/README README
> local: README remote: /pub/NetBSD/README
> 229 Entering Extended Passive Mode (|||53956|)
> 150 Opening BINARY mode data connection for /pub/NetBSD/README
> 100% |*************************************|  1729      53.19 KB/s    00:00    
> 226 Transfer complete.
> 1729 bytes received in 00:00 (49.79 KB/s)
> ftp> get pub/NetBSD/README README
> local: README remote: pub/NetBSD/README
> 229 Entering Extended Passive Mode (|||53964|)
> 150 Opening BINARY mode data connection for pub/NetBSD/README
>   0% |                                     |     0       0.00 KB/s    --:-- ETA
> 550 pub/NetBSD/README: No such file or directory

I'm attaching patch for modules/ftp/ftp_commands.c.

I can confirm this bug, using httpd 2.2.14 and mod_ftp 0.9.6 on Win2008. Anyone have suggestions for Win FTP clients that don't send relative paths in RETR? All the ones I've tried so far do, which makes mod_ftp useless for me with Win clients. Is there any other workaround (other than rebuild the server to move all the vhosts using FTP to a volume root folder)?
creator: nickneckthepirate@gmail.com

text:
(In reply to comment #1)
This is not in fact my problem. The problem is that the jrun-handler and mod_ftp do not appear to play nicely together. Any types assigned to jrun-handler with the AddHandler directive cannot be retrieved with mod_ftp. I've worked around for the moment with SetHandler default-handler inside the FTP vhosts. Will notify Adobe to see if they have a more concrete resolution.
